content.text:
# Buckinghamshire Record Society

The Buckinghamshire Record Society is a text publication society for the county of Buckinghamshire in England. It was established in 1947 when it was separated from the Buckinghamshire Archaeological Society. The society is a registered charity.
Selected publications
Publications of the society include:
Main series
* Vol. 1 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-01.pdf The Minute Book of the Monthly Meeting of the Society of Friends for the Upperside of Buckinghamshire, 1669-1690] (1937)
* Vol. 2 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-02.pdf The Cartulary of Missenden Abbey, Part 1] (1938)
* Vol. 3 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-03.pdf Early Buckinghamshire Charters]
* Vol. 4 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-04.pdf A Calendar of the Feet of Fines for the County of Buckingham, 7 Richard I to 44 Henry III]
* Vol. 5 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-05.pdf A Calendar of Deeds preserved in the Museum at Aylesbury]
* Vol. 6 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-06.pdf Calendar of the Roll of the Justices on Eyre, 1227]
* Vol. 7 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-07.pdf Episcopal Visitation Book for the Archdeaconry of Buckingham, 1662]
* Vol. 8 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-08.pdf Subsidy Roll for the County of Buckingham Anno 1524]
* Vol. 9 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-09.pdf The Cartulary of Snelshall Priory]
* Vol. 10 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-10.pdf The Cartulary of Missenden Abbey, Part 2]
* Vol. 11 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-11.pdf The First Ledger Book of High Wycombe and Borough of High Wycombe: Second Ledger Book, 1684-1770]
* Vol. 12 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-12.pdf The Cartulary of Missenden Abbey, Part 3]
* Vol. 13 ''[http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-13.pdf Ship Money Papers and Richard Grenville's Note-Book]
* Vol. 14 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-14.pdf Early Taxation Returns. Taxation of Personal Property in 1332 and later]
* Vol. 15 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-15.pdf Luffield Priory Charters, Part 1]
* Vol. 16 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-16.pdf The Letter-Books of Samuel Wilberforce, 1843-68]
* Vol. 17 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-17.pdf The Certificate of Musters for Buckinghamshire in 1522]
* Vol. 18 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-18.pdf Luffield Priory Charters, Part 2]
* Vol. 19 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-19.pdf The Courts of the Archdeaconry of Buckingham, 1483-1523]
* Vol. 20 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-20.pdf The Letters of Thomas Hayton, Vicar of Long Crendon, 1821-1887]
* Vol. 21 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-21.pdf Buckinghamshire Contributions for Ireland, 1642, and Richard Grenville's Military Accounts, 1642-1645]
* Vol. 22 [http://www.bucksrecsoc.org.uk/BRS-VOLUMES/brs-vol-22.pdf The Buckinghamshire Posse Comitatus 1798]
* Vol. 23 The Autobiography of Joseph Mayett of Quainton (1783-1839)
* Vol. 24 Buckinghamshire Probate Inventories, 1661-1714
* Vol. 25 A Calendar of the Feet of Fines for Buckinghamshire, 1259-1307, with an appendix, 1179-1259
* Vol. 26 Descriptions of Lord Cobham's Gardens at Stowe, 1700-1750
* Vol. 27 Buckinghamshire Returns of the Census of Religious Worship, 1851
* Vol. 28 Buckinghamshire Dissent and Parish Life, 1669-1712
* Vol. 29 Inquests and Indictments from Late Fourteenth Century Buckinghamshire
* Vol. 30 Buckinghamshire Glebe Terriers, 1578-1640
* Vol. 31 Recollections of Nineteenth Century Buckinghamshire
* Vol. 32 Index to Probate Records of the Archdeaconry Court of Buckingham, 1483-1660, and of the Buckinghamshire Peculiars, 1420-1660
* Vol. 33 The Household Book (1510-1551) of Sir Edward Don of Horsenden
* Vol. 34 The Buckinghamshire Eyre of 1286
* Vol. 35 The Winslow Manor Court Books, Part I, 1327-1377, and Part II, 1423-1460''
See also
* Centre for Buckinghamshire Studies
References
